Method Detail

generatePrime

public static java.math.BigInteger generatePrime()
Generation of a big prime.
This method randomly casts a number with NUM_OF_BITS bits, and uses the algorithm learned in class to determine if it is prime.
Complexity: since we are only checking for a number that is of the form 4k+3, k is positive integer, and taking into consideration The density of primes, it is likely that this method will return after O(NUM_OF_BITS) casts.

Returns:
a random prime p, p=4k+3, p is being represented with NUM_OF_BITS bits.

Parameters:

Returns:

gcd

public static java.math.BigInteger gcd(java.math.BigInteger n1,
                                       java.math.BigInteger n2)
GCD for BigInteger

Parameters:
n1 - a bigNubmer
n2 - a bigNubmer
Returns:
if n1>=0&& n2>=0 the return will be the g.c.d of n1,n2 complexity : O((NUM_OF_BITS)^3)

calculateInverse

public static java.math.BigInteger calculateInverse(java.math.BigInteger number,
                                                    java.math.BigInteger moduluN)
Using the extended Euclidean algorithm This Function Was Checked with Big Numbers

Parameters:
number - , the number we want to calculate the inverse to
moduluN - , is used to create a number from the Ring of g*_moduluN
Returns:
answer , where answer*n== 0 mod g*_n Complexity: O((NUM_OF_BITS)^3).

generateKey

public static Key[] generateKey()
This function generate a public and private key

Returns:
an array of keys of size 2
the first cell contains the private key (lambda,mu,n)
the second cell contains the public key (n,g)
